events.summary: A second-division women’s basketball team has filled its final roster spot before the domestic transfer deadline by signing its veteran point guard to a one-year extension with a reduced salary and incentives tied to games played following last season’s injury layoff.

outline.sentence: {Rivergate Rivets Women's Basketball Club|ORGANIZATION-1} signs {Elara Finch|PERSON-1} to a one‑year contract extension with a reduced base salary and performance incentives based on games played after {Elara Finch|PERSON-1}'s previous season's injury layoff.
The extension sets {Elara Finch|PERSON-1}'s base salary at $45,000 for the 2025‑26 season, with an additional $2,500 per game played beyond the first ten appearances.

{Midland Women's Basketball League|ORGANIZATION-2} officially records the registration of {Elara Finch|PERSON-1}'s extension with {Rivergate Rivets Women's Basketball Club|ORGANIZATION-1} before the domestic transfer deadline of 2025-03-20.
The league filed the contract under registration number {MWBL‑2025‑RIV‑EF|MISCELLANEOUS-1}, confirming compliance with the transfer deadline on March 20.

Coach {Dana Loris|PERSON-2} of {Rivergate Rivets Women's Basketball Club|ORGANIZATION-1} states that the terms of {Elara Finch|PERSON-1}'s extension provide roster stability while rewarding {Elara Finch|PERSON-1}'s availability post‑injury.

Coach {Dana Loris|PERSON-2} added in a press conference at the {Rivergate Sports Complex|BUILDING-1} that the incentive clause will activate only after {Elara Finch|PERSON-1} logs a minimum of 500 minutes on the court.

{Sundara Sportswear|ORGANIZATION-3}, the primary kit sponsor of {Rivergate Rivets Women's Basketball Club|ORGANIZATION-1}, releases a statement supporting the club's decision and notes that {Elara Finch|PERSON-1}'s marketability will be highlighted in upcoming promotional campaigns.

{Sundara Sportswear|ORGANIZATION-3} announced that {Elara Finch|PERSON-1} will appear in the upcoming “{Rise Together|MISCELLANEOUS-2}” winter apparel campaign, featuring a limited‑edition jersey released on April 5.

{Rivergate Rivets Women's Basketball Club|ORGANIZATION-1} announces that the reduced salary allocation from {Elara Finch|PERSON-1}'s extension frees cap space to sign a backup shooting guard before the season opener.
The freed cap space, estimated at $12,000, will be allocated to sign veteran guard {Maya Torres|PERSON-3} from the neighboring {Lakeside Lynx|ORGANIZATION-4} before the season opener on October 2.

continuation.summary: The limited‑edition “Rise Together” jersey showcasing Elara Finch hit store shelves on April 5, selling out its first 3,000 units within 48 hours.

events.summary: The limited‑edition “Rise Together” jersey showcasing Elara Finch hit store shelves on April 5, selling out its first 3,000 units within 48 hours.

outline.sentence: {Sundara Sportswear|ORGANIZATION-3} released the limited‑edition {Rise Together|MISCELLANEOUS-2} {Rise Together jersey|PRODUCT-1} featuring {Elara Finch|PERSON-1} on 2025-04-05 at the {Sundara Sportswear|ORGANIZATION-3} flagship store in {Sunvale|LOCATION-1}.

The jersey, crafted from 85% recycled polyester with a moisture‑wicking interior, was priced at $119 and the launch ceremony was attended by coach {Dana Loris|PERSON-2}, {Rivergate Rivets Women's Basketball Club|ORGANIZATION-1} mayoral representative, and local media.

The limited‑edition {Rise Together|MISCELLANEOUS-2} {Rise Together jersey|PRODUCT-1} sold out its initial allocation of 3,000 units within 48 hours at {Sundara Sportswear|ORGANIZATION-3} retail locations and the {Rivergate Rivets Women's Basketball Club|ORGANIZATION-1} online store.

Sales data show 1,820 units were purchased at the {Sunvale|LOCATION-1} flagship, 620 through the online store, and 560 at regional {Sundara Sportswear|ORGANIZATION-3} outlets, with 2,500 units sold in the first 24 hours.

{Rivergate Rivets Women's Basketball Club|ORGANIZATION-1} announced that all net proceeds from the limited‑edition {Rise Together|MISCELLANEOUS-2} {Rise Together jersey|PRODUCT-1} sales will be allocated to fund a free community basketball clinic in {Rivergate|LOCATION-2} scheduled for June 2025.

The club estimates net proceeds of approximately $180,000, which will fund a two‑day clinic at the {Rivergate Community Center|BUILDING-2} for up to 150 local youth, featuring coaching staff from the {Rivergate Rivets Women's Basketball Club|ORGANIZATION-1} and guest trainers.

{Elara Finch|PERSON-1} issued a public statement praising the limited‑edition {Rise Together|MISCELLANEOUS-2} {Rise Together jersey|PRODUCT-1} and confirming her participation in the upcoming community basketball clinic organized by {Rivergate Rivets Women's Basketball Club|ORGANIZATION-1}.

In her statement, {Elara Finch|PERSON-1} said, “Wearing this jersey reminds me of the fans who lift us every game, and I can’t wait to share skills and stories at the June 12 clinic,” confirming she will lead a shooting‑drills workshop.

{Sundara Sportswear|ORGANIZATION-3} confirmed a supplemental production run of 2,000 limited‑edition {Rise Together|MISCELLANEOUS-2} {Rise Together jersey|PRODUCT-1} jerseys to meet continued demand, with delivery planned for early May 2025.

The additional 2,000 jerseys will be manufactured at {Sundara Sportswear|ORGANIZATION-3}’s {Greenfield eco‑factory|BUILDING-3} and are scheduled to ship on May 3, 2025, to be stocked at the same retail locations and the online store.

continuation.summary: Maya Torres bruised her ankle in the Rivets’ second game on 4 October 2025, limiting her effectiveness and leading Coach Loris to cut her minutes rather than call up a rookie reserve.

person.name: Elara Finch

summary: A second-division women’s basketball team has filled its final roster spot before the domestic transfer deadline by signing its veteran point guard to a one-year extension with a reduced salary and incentives tied to games played following last season’s injury layoff.
